page.title: 05 THE VILLAGE SHOPS
page.content: Both the villages in the survey area have a village shop and post office. They supply a wide variety of items ranging from groceries to articles of clothing, home-produced honey locally made pottery and cylinders of gas. The village shops find it very difficult to compete with prices in the chain stores and supermarkets at nearby Knighton and Newtown. Many people travel to these towns for their weekly shopping although some realize the importance of supporting the village stores in order to retain them. At these village post offices it is possible to renew dog and television licences, and to pay telephone bills and water rates. Villagers are also able to collect their pensions, child benefit allowance, sickness benefit and DHSS payment. Also on sale are premium bonds and savings schemes.
